poem:
### Silent Arsenal

Beneath the iron dome, whispers of stars—  
a sky laced with tension, maps scorched thin,  
footsteps of parched prophets shuffle under footfall.  
Stories of dust and steel never told,  
as truths crumble with each missile's miss;  
an edge of peace, fragile lace on loom,  
woven against whispers of what might become.

But as Israel prepares". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
